info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:17AM EDT until June 27 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHESTERFIELD...CHARLES CITY...PRINCE GEORGE...WEST CENTRAL NEW KENT...SOUTHEASTERN HENRICO...NORTHEASTERN DINWIDDIE AND NORTHWESTERN SURRY COUNTIES...THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS...THE CITY OF HOPEWELL AND THE CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 1216 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Matoaca to Petersburg to near Disputanta, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Disputanta and Prince George around 1225 AM EDT. Hopewell and Fort Gregg-Adams around 1230 AM EDT. Jordans Point around 1240 AM EDT. Burrowsville and Garysville around 1245 AM EDT. Cabin Point around 1250 AM EDT. Charles City, Claremont and Ruthville around 1255 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Taylors Corner, Wayside, Birchett Estate, Spring Grove, Brandon, Elko, Jordan Point Country Club, Petersburg National Battlefield, Barham and Glendale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
